title: Coastguard Ends Search for Missing Christmas Day Swimmers
summary: On Christmas Day, a tragic incident occurred in Budleigh Salterton, Devon, where two men, aged in their 40s and 60s, went missing during a sea swim. Emergency services were alerted around 10:25 GMT, and while some swimmers were rescued, these two individuals could not be located. The coastguard conducted a search operation in the water until 17:00 GMT, after which it was called off, though police continued on-shore investigations into the evening. The families of the missing men have been informed. Witnesses described the sea conditions as particularly rough and cold, with waves estimated at 5-6 feet high, making it hazardous. In response, police in Devon and Cornwall have advised against entering the water, and some planned swims have been cancelled. Local residents expressed shock and sadness over the event, emphasizing its tragic nature on a holiday. This incident underscores the risks of swimming in adverse weather and the challenges faced by rescue services.
